title: Ether whale population drops after Shapella — Will ETH price sink too? - Cointelegraph
summary: Ether whale population has decreased since Ethereum's Shapella upgrade, suggesting that large investors may be leaning bearish in the near term. The share of Ether held by addresses with 1,000-10,000 ETH, or "whales," dropped from 14.033 million ETH on May 1 to 14.167 million ETH on April 12. Only shrimps (<1 ETH) accumulated during the period, with their net position slightly increasing. The Shapella upgrade enabled investors to withdraw ETH locked via staking, which some argued would increase selling pressure. Since the upgrade, over 1.97 million ETH worth around $3.6 billion has been withdrawn, but no major changes in cryptocurrency exchanges' ETH balances have been seen. Historically, fewer Ether whales typically means heightened downside risk for the ETH price. However, the price-to-whale positive correlation existed until March 2020, and the inverse correlation continued throughout the price downtrend to around $850 in June 20

title: How to Bridge From Solana to Ethereum - Watcher Guru
summary:
Title: How to Bridge From Solana to Ethereum

Summary: Solana has gained popularity in DeFi, NFT, and Web3 markets since its launch in April 2019. Hundreds of projects are underway, and users may want to bridge assets from Solana to Ethereum. Bridging involves transferring tokens or coins from one blockchain to another. Solana and Ethereum have interoperability, allowing users to easily transfer assets between the two networks. Three options are available for bridging from Solana to Ethereum: Allbridge, Portal Bridge, and using a CEX. Each method has its steps and considerations, including security risks associated with CEXs.

title: Cardano Founder Charles Hoskinson Responds to Jab by Ethereum Co-Founder - DailyCoin
summary: Charles Hoskinson, the founder of Cardano, was criticized by an Ethereum co-founder, Fabian Vogelsteller, who claimed that Hoskinson built "literally nothing" for Ethereum. Hoskinson responded with sarcasm, thanking Vogelsteller for his opinion and hinting at Switzerland and Cardano. Vogelsteller clarified that he meant no offense to Hoskinson's work or skills, but rather that he did not contribute anything significant to Ethereum through code. The controversy has sparked a larger discussion about the role of Hoskinson in the crypto community and the potential for Cardano to replace Ethereum.

title: Sotheby’s launches NFT marketplace for transactions on Ethereum, Polygon networks - Forkast News
summary: Sotheby's, a leading auction house, has launched an online secondary marketplace for non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the Ethereum and Polygon networks. The platform will feature a rotating selection of curated NFTs, with transactions executed on-chain and artist resale royalties honored directly on-chain. Sotheby's is an early adopter of cryptocurrency in the auction world, having sold a diamond for HK$95.1 million (US$12.1 million) in an unspecified cryptocurrency in 2021. The launch of the NFT marketplace comes after Sotheby's announced it will hold sales of NFT artwork belonging to the bankrupt crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital.

title: Sports Illustrated Embraces Ethereum for NFT Event Tickets - Decrypt
summary: Sports Illustrated (SI) has launched Box Office, a new NFT ticketing platform built on the Ethereum scaling network Polygon. SI Tickets, a division of Sports Illustrated, aims to create mass adoption of NFT ticketing by offering exclusive benefits, lower fees, and a 50-50 revenue split on resales. Box Office will list tickets for smaller community events, including youth sports, music venues, and conferences, in addition to major events. The platform offers NFT tickets with additional content, such as photo and video highlights, and will track on-chain data for resale revenue. SI Tickets CEO David Lane believes this will become the standard for ticketing as the global economy recovers from the pandemic, and the platform will provide visibility for events that partner with them.

title: Curve Tests New Stablecoin crvUSD Ahead of Ethereum Mainnet Launch - DailyCoin
summary: Curve, a decentralized finance platform, is launching a new stablecoin called crvUSD, backed by various crypto assets and using a novel lending-liquidating algorithm. This comes as the crypto industry faces instability in stablecoins during the current bear market. CrvUSD aims to outcompete existing centralized stablecoins like USDC and USDT, which have depegged. Circle CEO has called for stablecoin legislation in the US to combat de-dollarization, while Polygon Labs has partnered with Google Cloud to drive ecosystem growth.

title: SEC crackdown on crypto staking in the US could boost decentralization - Cointelegraph
summary: The SEC is cracking down on crypto staking in the US, which could lead to decentralization. The Ethereum network has seen over a million ETH withdrawn from validators, but most are being re-staked. The future of staking services in the US is uncertain, with centralized exchanges like Coinbase facing regulatory battles. The SEC's efforts to curtail staking service providers may force retail staking to move offshore, leading to a regulatory void that could be exploited by bad actors. Decentralized staking services may become more popular, but it remains to be seen how US-based service providers will respond to the SEC's guidance and securities laws.

title: Curve Finance's crvUSD stablecoin deployed on Sepolia testnet - The Block
summary: Curve Finance, a decentralized exchange, has deployed smart contracts for its crvUSD stablecoin on the Sepolia testnet. This deployment marks a step closer to a mainnet release of the platform and stablecoin. crvUSD will be pegged to the US dollar and overcollateralized by supported crypto assets, with a new algorithm called LLAMMA to manage risk and maintain the stablecoin's peg. The stablecoin will compete in a highly competitive field dominated by centralized stablecoins like USDT and USDC, but its decentralized nature and focus on stablecoins could give it an advantage.

title: Crypto Price Today: Bitcoin hovering below $28k, Ethereum and most other tokens slide - CNBCTV18

title: Phantom Solana Wallet Adds Ethereum and Polygon Support - TOKENPOST
summary: Phantom Wallet, a self-custodial wallet, has expanded its support to include Ethereum and Polygon networks, allowing users to access dApps across the Web3 landscape, including Uniswap, Aave, blur, OpenSea, and Magic Eden. The update aims to simplify managing multiple accounts and assets across blockchains, and Phantom has onboarded over 100,000 users since its beta launch last fall. The company has also stepped up security measures and plans to introduce instant NFT sales and a bridge for transferring assets between Solana and Ethereum networks.

title: Everything You Need To Know About Blockchain Size - Blockchain Magazine
summary: The size of a blockchain is an important issue, as it affects the scalability and performance of the network. The current size of the bitcoin blockchain is around 250 GB, and it is expected to reach 1 TB by 2030. However, not every node needs to download the entire blockchain to become operational, and some nodes are referred to as "full nodes" that download the entire data set to validate transactions. The size limit for bitcoin blockchains is 1 MB, but some of the space inside this limit is unusable. The size of the Ethereum ledger is expanding at a faster rate than that of bitcoin, and it has issues with scalability and size as well. The consequences of a large blockchain size include slower transactions, longer time to solve a block, and increased storage costs. Startups developing applications on Ethereum and bitcoin should not be concerned with the scale of the blockchain at this time, as Ethereum already has pruning, which reduces the amount of blockchain data required by a complete node.
